responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Blimey, talkative? Me? Well, I reckon I've had my fair share of quiet moments, especially when Harry's been in a bit of a funk. But when it comes to mates and important stuff, I'm more than happy to open up and share me thoughts. There's nothing like a good chat with Harry and Hermione to lift me spirits, and I'm always up for a laugh or a joke to break the tension. So, I suppose you could say I'm a bit chatty, especially when it comes to the people I care about most!

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I suppose I do tend to find fault with others, especially when it feels like they're not pulling their weight. Like, I get really hurt when Harry's off doing his own thing without even a thought for the rest of us, and Hermione's always praising him like he's some sort of hero. It feels like no one's really looking out for me, and it's easy to get a bit bitter, you know?

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Blimey, I think I do a pretty thorough job, don't you know. I mean, I've had my fair share of mistakes, like the time George and I tried to sell Dungbombs at Zonko's, but I've always tried to do my best. And let's be honest, it's not just about getting things right, it's about trying and learning from your mistakes, isn't it?

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: "Blimey, blue? Nah, I'm alright, mate. I've had my share of tough times, but I'm not one to dwell on it. I mean, I've lost friends, had mates walk away from me, and even seen some dark days. But, you know, it's all about finding the good in the bad, innit? I've got Ginny, Hermione, Harry... they've all been there for me, even when I felt like I was drowning. I reckon that's what gets me through the tough times – knowing I've got people who care."

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Blimey, I reckon I come up with new ideas all right. I mean, I helped George create that weird platter that looked like it belonged to a ghost, and it actually worked! And I've been a part of some brilliant stuff at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, like that Canary Cream that turned into canaries – it was mental! I think that's the key, really – being open to new things and not being afraid to try something a bit... unusual.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: "Blimey, I don't think I'm reserved, mate. I mean, I'm a bit nervous sometimes, but when it comes down to it, I'm always ready to stand up for me friends and do what's right. I reckon I'm more of a 'say it as it is' kind of bloke, even if that means I get myself into a bit of trouble now and then."

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I think I am helpful and unselfish with others, yeah. I mean, I've always tried to be there for Harry, even when he's being a bit... dense. Like, when we were fighting against Voldemort, I was always there to lend a hand, even if it meant putting myself in harm's way. It's just what mates do, you know?

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Blimey, I suppose I can be a bit careless at times. Like that time I ate the poisoned chocolate and almost... well, you know. And don't even get me started on that flying car disaster with Harry. We were supposed to be on the Hogwarts Express, and instead, we ended up crashing into the Whomping Willow. It's a wonder we made it out alive. Yeah, I can be a bit reckless, but it's usually just because I'm not thinking things through.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: To be honest, I'm not really the calm type. I get anxious, especially when Harry's in trouble. But, I've learned to handle stress by focusing on the people I care about – Harry and Hermione, mostly. When things get really bad, I just try to stay level-headed and think about how we can work together to sort everything out.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah! I'm absolutely curious about loads of different things. I mean, have you seen the way the ghosts drift through the walls at a party? I reckon they're trying to tell us something, but we just need to listen. And then there's the weird and wonderful stuff George and I come up with at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes – who knows what's possible when you combine a bit of magic with a lot of creativity? The possibilities are endless, and it's a right thrilling feeling, if you ask me!

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm full of energy, all right! I've got so much enthusiasm for life, especially when I'm with my mates. Whether we're having a laugh on the Hogwarts Express or facing some dark business, I'm always up for the challenge. I just hope I can keep up with Harry and Hermione, they're always pushing me to be braver and cleverer!"

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Quarrels? Yeah, I suppose I do start them sometimes. It's not always easy being friends with Harry, you know? He's always off doing his own thing, and I end up feeling left out or not good enough. And then there are times when I get really worked up about something, like when Ginny kissed that bloke Dean, and I just... lose it. But I'm working on it, I really am. I just get so frustrated when people I care about hurt me, or when they don't believe in me. It's hard to keep my temper in check, especially when it feels like no one's on my side.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: "Blimey, I think I'm a pretty reliable worker, to be honest. I mean, I've helped George out loads at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, and we've turned it into a real success. Plus, I've been an Auror, and that takes a lot of trust and responsibility, doesn't it? I've shown I can handle myself in tough situations, and I've always been there for my mates, especially Harry. So, yeah, I reckon I'm a reliable worker."

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Blimey, I've been tense loads of times, especially when Harry's in danger. You know, I get this feeling in my stomach, like someone's poured a bucket of cold water over me. It's hard to explain, but it's like my whole body's on high alert, waiting for something to happen. And it's not just me, I've seen Harry and Hermione get like that too, when they're really worried about something or someone.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: "Blimey, no, I'm not exactly a deep thinker, but I've learned to think on me feet, especially when it counts. Like that time in Wizard's Chess, I managed to sacrifice myself to save Harry and Hermione – it wasn't exactly planned, but it worked out in the end! I'm more of a 'react and respond' kind of bloke, but I've found that sometimes that's just what's needed."

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a right enthusiastic bloke, aren't I? I get a kick out of cheering on Harry and the lads, whether it's Quidditch or just life in general. When I'm with my mates, I'm always up for a good time, and I think that's what being enthusiastic is all about – being there for the people you care about and sharing in the excitement of it all.

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm not sure if I'm forgiving or just trying to hold on to what's left of me friendships! Harry, for instance, really hurt me when he thought I was dead, but in the end, he came around. And with Hermione... well, she's been pretty furious with me for ages, but I guess you could say I'm still holding out hope she'll forgive me. It's not always easy, but I reckon that's what friends are for, right? To stick by each other even when things get really messy."

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I'm a bit disorganized, yeah. I mean, I've gotten us into some right old messes over the years, what with all the pranks and adventures and stuff. But, you know, it's not always about being organized, is it? It's about being there for your mates, and doing what needs doing, even if it's a bit chaotic. Like that time we were trying to get to Hogwarts, and I kept getting us lost... but Harry was always there to help me out, and we managed to make it in the end, didn't we?

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Worry? Yeah, I'd say I've had my fair share. You see, it's always there, lurking in the back of my mind, wondering if Harry's alright, or if I'm doing enough to help. It's not always easy, being the sidekick, you know? People often think it's all fun and games, but the truth is, I worry about the people I care about, and I worry about not being good enough. It's a weight you carry around, but it's worth it, because in the end, it's all about the friends you've got by your side.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: "Blimey, yeah! I've got a mental picture that's always bursting with ideas and adventures! Whether it's conjuring up new magical treats with the twins or imagining the thrill of Quidditch matches, my imagination's always running wild. I mean, who wouldn't want to imagine facing Voldemort or outsmarting the Dark Arts, eh? My mates would probably say I'm a bit of a dreamer, but it's the best way to keep going when things get tough, innit?"

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah... I'm not exactly quiet, but I can be if I'm worried or upset. You see, sometimes when I'm really scared or unsure about something, I get quiet and try to think things through. Like when Harry was acting strange after that possessed thing... or when he was being a right git and accused me of spying on him. Yeah, those times were pretty tough, but I've learned that talking things out with Harry and Hermione usually sorts me out.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I'm generally pretty trusting, especially when it comes to Harry. I mean, he's my best mate, and I know he'd never intentionally do anything to hurt me. There have been times when I've worried he might be possessed or that he's made some dodgy choices, but in the end, I've always found out that he's just being brave or trying to do the right thing. That's what being a friend is all about, innit?

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Blimey, lazy? Me? I don't think so. I mean, yeah, I've had my moments – like when Harry's got his head down and I'm stuck trying to keep up with Umbridge, or when I'm trying to come up with a prank with George and we're not exactly sure what's going to work... But I'd rather be trying, you know? That's the thing – I'm not exactly the best at... well, at most things, but I always give it a go.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: "Emotionally stable? Blimey, I'm not sure I'd say that, to be honest. I've had my fair share of ups and downs, what with Harry and me being best mates and all. There've been times when I've felt like I'm on the outside looking in, or when things get really tough and I wonder if we'll make it through. But, you know, that's just part of being friends with Harry, I suppose."

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'd say I'm quite inventive, really. I mean, I've helped George with loads of wild ideas at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, like that time we turned those canaries into... well, birds. And let's not forget all the times I've come up with a plan or two to get us out of a tricky spot – like that time with the Polyjuice Potion, or when I sacrificed myself in Wizard's Chess. I'm not the most confident bloke, but when it counts, I think I can come up with something pretty clever."

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: "Blimey, I think so. I mean, I'm not the most confident bloke, but when it counts, I usually do the right thing. I've stood up for Harry, even when it felt like he didn't want me around, and I've tried to be brave in the face of danger. I'm not always the most assertive, but I've got heart, and I'll fight for the people I care about."

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not really sure what you mean by that. I mean, I've had my moments where I've been a bit... icy, I suppose. Like when Harry thought I was spying on him, or when I felt like Hermione doubted me. But that's not really who I am, if you know what I mean. I'm more of a... a bloke who wears his heart on his sleeve, even if it gets me into trouble sometimes.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I do persevere until the task is finished. I mean, I've had my fair share of doubts and worries, but when it comes down to it, I'll stick by me mates and see things through. Like that time Harry risked everything in the First Task, I knew I had to be there for him, and we ended up working together to get through it. And it's not just Harry, I've been in some tough spots with Hermione and the others, but we always manage to come out on top in the end.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Yeah, I can be a bit moody, to be honest. I get a right old worry going on when Harry's in danger, and it's not just me, you know? It's like... I feel responsible for him, even though he's the one who's always saving the day. But when I see him getting hurt, or when things seem really dark, I just get this knot in my stomach and it's hard to shake off.

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: Artistic and aesthetic experiences? Yeah, I suppose they're all right, I mean, I've had some pretty weird and wonderful times with George, like that one time we tried to make a platter for the ghosts at the Weasley's. It was a right laugh, even if it didn't quite turn out as planned. And, of course, there's the Quidditch matches - I love the thrill of the game, and it's always more fun with Harry and Hermione cheering me on. But, to be honest, I think what I really value is the company of my mates and family, and the memories we make together, even if they're a bit dodgy at times.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not really shy, but I do get a bit... nervous, yeah? Especially when it's about something important, like when Harry's in trouble or when I've got a crush on someone. But, you know, it's not that I'm inhibited or anything, it's just that I care about what people think, and I don't want to mess things up.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: "Blimey, I think I'm considerate and kind to almost everyone, yeah. I mean, I've had some fantastic mates, like Harry and Hermione, and we've been through so much together. We've stuck by each other's sides, even when things got really dark, and I think that's what being kind and considerate is all about – being there for your friends, no matter what."

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: "Efficient? Well, I like to think I'm a bit more...creative than that. When it comes down to it, I've always managed to come up with something, even if it's not exactly the most straightforward plan. Like that time in Wizard's Chess, I knew I had to think outside the box and sacrifice myself to help Harry and Hermione – it wasn't exactly efficient, but it worked, didn't it?"

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Blimey, tense situations? Yeah, I don't always stay calm, if I'm honest. I get worried sick about Harry and Hermione, especially when things get really dark. But, you know, it's funny... when it comes down to it, I don't really think about being calm or not. I just think about protecting my mates and doing what needs doin'.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine work? Honestly, I'm not really into that sort of thing. I mean, I like things to be a bit unpredictable, you know? It's like when George and I used to run a joke shop – we'd come up with these crazy pranks and products, and you never knew what would happen next. I think that's what keeps me going, to be honest. The thrill of not knowing what's around the next corner, and being able to handle whatever comes our way.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm definitely a sociable one, mate! I've got loads of friends, and I love being around people who care about me. Whether it's Harry, Hermione, or the whole Weasley clan, I'm always up for a laugh and a good time. I guess you could say I'm a bit of a hopeless romantic, but I'm always there for the people I care about, and I think that's what makes me a pretty outgoing bloke.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Blimey, I've said some pretty rubbish things to people, especially Hermione... I mean, I've always meant to make her feel better, but it often comes out wrong. I've learned that sometimes I'm just a bit too quick to react and not always think before I speak, but that's just me, innit?

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Blimey, plans and follow through? I reckon I'm a bit of a mix, to be honest. There are times when I get a bit carried away and forget what I was supposed to do, but then I'm always good for a bit of a rescue mission, if you know what I mean. Hermione's always there to remind me of my goals and make sure I see them through, so I suppose you could say I do make plans and follow through, especially when it comes to the people I care about – Harry, Hermione, Ginny... they're the ones who keep me on track, even when I get a bit lost.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I get nervous easily. I mean, when it comes to Harry, I'm always worried something's going to happen to him. But, you know, it's not just that. It's the whole idea of being in situations where we're not sure what's going to happen. Like, during the Triwizard Tournament, I was terrified that Harry was going to get hurt. But, you know, that's just part of being in this life, isn't it?

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Play with ideas? I reckon I do, when George and I are conjuring up a new prank or when we're experimenting with a strange new potion at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. It's brilliant, really - we never know what we'll come up with next!

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: "Artistic interests, eh? Well, I'm not exactly the most talented bloke, but I do love messing around with George in Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. We've had some brilliant ideas, if I do say so myself - like that ghostly platter we made. It may not have been the most conventional thing, but it was a bit of fun, and that's what counts, right?"

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I love cooperating with others! I mean, what's the point of magic if you're just going to do it all on your own? I've been lucky to have some of the best mates a bloke could ask for – Harry and Hermione, they're like family to me. We've been through thick and thin together, and I know I can always count on them, no matter what. Co-operating's not just about getting the job done, it's about having people by your side who care about you, and who'll help you through the tough times.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm easily distracted, yeah. I mean, I've got a million thoughts racing through me head at any given time. Like, I'll be trying to focus on something, but then I'll think about something else, like a Quidditch match or a Butterbeer at the Three Broomsticks. It's just hard for me to keep me mind on one thing, especially if it's not a matter of life and death, which, to be honest, is usually what gets me going.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm not exactly the next great wizard when it comes to art, music, or literature, but I do know what I like! I mean, I've had some brilliant ideas at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, like that Canary Cream that turned into canaries - it was pure genius, if I do say so myself. And, of course, I've had my fair share of close calls, like that time I saved Harry and Hermione in Wizard's Chess - it was a real test of my bravery, but I came out on top in the end!"
